---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [a754b15848](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17633/commits/a754b158480b1fa896ab9bbf3a15958404110889)

#### Import changes for modified files

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ iff_isSeparable`
`+ of_isSeparable`
`+ of_isSeparable_aux`
`+++ iff_of_equiv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Okay I added some comments and a reference.

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11531963030/job/32103254540)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11532320704/job/32103996855)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11532320704/job/32103996754)

I guess I'd be happier if these long proofs (one of them is > 50 lines) had some kind of comments in, or at least a *precise* reference to Iversen rather than just a reference to the entire book. But other than that this is fine.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I guess I'd be happier if these long proofs (one of them is > 50 lines) had some kind of comments in, or at least a *precise* reference to Iversen rather than just a reference to the entire book. But other than that this is fine.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
- `Algebra.FormallyEtale.iff_isSeparable`:
    If `L` is (essentially) of finite type over `K`, then `L/K` is etale iff `L/K` is separable.
```
Would it make sense to rephrase this as a `tfae` including `FormallyEtale`, `FormallyUnramified` and `IsSeparable`?
I don't think `tfae` lemmas are that useful application wise. But it might be a good sanity check and I'll add it once we have the equivalence with smooth-ness.
Maybe this should have a docstring or a comment saying "don't use this, it's a weaker version of `of_isSeparable`?

```suggestion
    · exact Ideal.mul_mem_mul hu (Ideal.Quotient.eq_zero_iff_mem.mp hx')
```
I thought we had a linter which would moan about this sort of thing now? But it didn't so I'll moan about it :-)

```suggestion
/--
This is a weaker version of `of_isSeparable` that additionally assumes `EssFiniteType K L`.
Use that instead.
-/
theorem of_isSeparable_aux [Algebra.IsSeparable K L] [EssFiniteType K L] :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Etale): etale <=> separable for field extensions of finite type.
